授業目的:
This course serves as an introduction to the study of management. It is designed to help the students understand the basic principles, functions, and role of management in organizations and society. The course covers both contemporary issues in management and discussion on traditional functions of management including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling. 
This course will help students to develop skills, competencies, techniques, and knowledge needed to successfully manage an organization in today’s competitive environment.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:

a) Identify the principles of managing an organization.
b) Outline the historical evolution of management theories.
c) Explain the key functions of management including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling.
d) Evaluate the various challenges faced by today’s managers.
e) Apply the theoretical knowledge in solving managerial and organizational problems.
f) Enhance their presentation and communication skills.
g) Increase their abilities to participate in interactive class environment and work in small teams.
授業方法: This course will be offered in face-to-face format.
